intro: Trifolium triste, commonly known as the sorrowful clover, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Trifolium triste is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
